intro: Cleomella gracilis, commonly known as slender cleome, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Its flowers are small, yellowish-white, and clustered in loose inflorescences, producing a delicate, fragrant aroma. This plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural settings.
